result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C. Gleason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Lincoln County Clerk of Circuit Court
Lincoln County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court orders that for a period of 26 months on each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration be equipped with an ignition interlock device.

Also, pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court further orders that for a period of 26 months, beginning on the date the Department of Transportation issues any license to the defendant granted under Ch. 343, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the defendant's operating privileges for the operation of Class D vehicles be restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device.
Consecutive to: 13CF293

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C. Gleason

records.addlTxt: Remedial Contempt Order

Joseph C. Gleason does not appear in court. Nancy L. Bergstrom appears for Lincoln County. Cases are called. County is heard. Default judgment is entered by the Court, a lump sum payment in the amount of $600 is ordered; payment plan in the amount of $150/mo beginning on December 2, 2019 and every month thereafter by the 1st untl balance is paid in full; 30 days jail STAYED for failure to comply with lump sum payment and/or payment plan. Jail as sanction does not satisfy balance. Full balance will be due if taken into custody.
Notice and Order to Show Cause
Motion for Contempt and to Impose Sanctions
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Joseph C. Gleason in court, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant would like to proceed without counsel - Off record for defendant to read revocation order and warrant additional pages - On record - Defendant takes issues with a couple of factual issues - Statements by defendant regarding factual issues - Arguments by DA Bayne-Allison to sentencing - Arguments by Gleason to sentencing - Defendant asking if time is going to run concurrent - 
14CF302 - Court sentences defendant to 1 year jail with huber each count concurrent - Credit for 174 days served
14CF109 - Court sentences defendant to 1 year jail with huber with Credit for 281 days served - Defendant does not understand
Cases and charges to run concurrent - Civil judgment for unpaid court obligations - Post conviction rights given
